column2: NEW JERSEY PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: NJ

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: rideplaning.

column2: 2. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column10: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection

column2: 4. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column6: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column10: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 5. If your windshield wipers stop suddenly during rain you should:
column4: brake and pull off the road.
column6: roll down the driver's side window and put your head out so you can see ahead.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 7. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column4: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
column6: frequent rest stops.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road ahead

column2: 9. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 10. When changing lanes, you should not:
column6: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column8: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column10: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots

column2: 11. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column6: drive with the flow of traffic.
column10: drive faster than the flow of traffic.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: Side Road

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column6: Stop before turning right
column10: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 14. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column6: Do not panic.

column2: 15. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: Proceed with caution

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column6: Divided highway ahead

column2: 17. Passing is prohibited:
column4: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column6: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.

column2: 18. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the right side mirror.
column6: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column10: look into the left side mirror.

column2: 19. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column6: A steady red light.

column2: 20. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 21. All New Jersey driver license applicants must complete 6 Point ID Verification by presenting documents that prove:
column6: their age.

column2: 22. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 23. A flashing red light means:
column4: The same as a STOP sign.
column6: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 24. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column6: Vertical rectangle

column2: 25. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: come to a complete stop.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 26. As you drive, you must turn your headlights on:
column6: one-half hour after sunset.
column8: when the road ahead is clear.

column2: 27. When driving on major highways you should:
column6: stay alert.
column8: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 28. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column10: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Double curve ahead.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 30. What does this road sign indicate?
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 31. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column6: green, yellow and red.

column2: 32. A red traffic sign means?
column6: Railroad crossing.

column2: 33. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.
column6: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 34. This is:
column6: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 35. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column6: Whoever enters the intersection first.

column2: 36. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 37. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column6: when you first see the exit sign.
column8: once you see the toll booth.
column10: before moving into the exit lane.

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 39. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column6: change lanes.
column10: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 40. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column6: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column8: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column10: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.

column2: 41. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column6: solid or broken yellow

column2: 42. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 43. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column8: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 44. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 45. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column2: 46. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column6: blue and white.

column2: 47. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 48. When you approach this sign, you must:
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 49. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column6: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column8: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column10: only if you have an emergency.

column2: 50. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column6: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column8: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column10: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
